abstract: Chancellor Leo Strine of Delaware’s Court of Chancery also defended the work by a special committee of Dell’s board, saying that its actions benefited shareholders.
snippet: Chancellor Leo Strine of Delaware’s Court of Chancery also defended the work by a special committee of Dell’s board, saying that its actions benefited shareholders.
lead_paragraph: Updated, 6:03 p.m. | A Delaware judge on Friday denied a bid by Carl C. Icahn to derail a vote on a nearly $25 billion takeover bid for Dell Inc., dealing a blow to his fight against the buyout offer.

headline.main: Judge’s Ruling Removes Hurdles to a Dell Takeover Bid
headline.print_headline: In a Setback for Icahn, Judge Removes Hurdles to a Dell Takeover Bid

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced
